titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the David Rockefeller Fund records FA1774

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-04-01 04:19:50 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: 7 record storage boxes and 1 half-letter document box

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records ten years old and older are open for research. Brittle or damaged materials are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The David Rockefeller Fund was created in 1989 by David and Peggy Rockefeller to support charitable organizations in communities, outside of New York City, where they had homes (particularly in Maine and in Columbia and Westchester counties in New York). In 2001, David Rockefeller expanded the fund and encouraged his children and grandchildren to become active participants in its philanthropic direction and grantmaking.

The Citizenship Program was the name the fund gave its community grantmaking, from 1990-2009. Starting in 2001, the fund added a second program area, the Family Interest Program, which made grants in Arts and Education, Criminal Justice, and the Environment. The David Rockefeller Fund continues to concentrate on the Arts, Criminal Justice, and the Environment in its current grantmaking. The fund has also regularly encouraged and supported the special philanthropic interests of individual family members as well as their collaborative projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The David Rockefeller Fund records include materials relating to its Citizenship Program grants and Family Interest Program grants (from 2001-2006), as well as to Discretionary grants (from 2001-2005). It also contains Board meeting and other records from 1989-1992 and from 1999-2004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Intellectually arranged in series by program or record type.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Expedited Access - Processing Level 1 - File-Level Access. Records remain in original housing. Additional processing will be conducted in the future to enhance access and long-term preservation.
